CoreData Python API

1. Introduction
2. Distribution
3. Using CoreData
4. Compiling CoreData
5. Example Applications
6. Reference

1. Introduction

The CoreData Python API is the Python bindings for the open-source CoreData C++ library for working with data produced by Seeing Machines products.

2. Distribution

2.1 Platform/Compiler Support

The CoreData Python API is supported on the following platforms and compilers
  • Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7:
    • Visual Studio .NET 2008 Tested with Python 2.6

2.2 Directory Structure

coredata-3.2.1.65799/   <-- User selected installation directory (where xxx is a build number)
  doc/                <-- API documentation
  pycoredata/         <-- CoreData Python API 
      examples/       <-- Example applications
      lib/            <-- Precompiled python bindings
      src/            <-- Source code
  swigcoredata/       <-- Swig interface files

3. Using CoreData

This section describes how to use the CoreData Python API.

3.1 Modules

To use CoreData, the "pycoredata/lib/win32_ia32sse2_vc90" directory must be added to the PYTHONPATH or the directory needs to be copied under the python site-libs directory.(see Directory Structure).

Add the coredata/libshared/win32_ia32sse2_vc90 directory to the PATH environment variable.

Client code needs to import the appropriate modules: 

import sm.eod       # Import CoreData types
import sm.eod.io    # Import IO classes
import sm.eod.utils # Import geometric and output helper functions

4. Compiling CoreData

The CoreData distribution includes the full source code required to recompile the Python bindings.

We recommend you try to limit changes to the CoreData source and document these changes, so that when future CoreData releases are made you can update your code quickly and easily.

For compilation instructions, please refer to the appropriate instructions for your platform:

  • Microsoft Visual C++ .NET 2008

5. Example Applications

  • dumplog - Dumps CoreData log files to stdout.
  • extractlog - Read Data and Saves to Logfiles
  • gazeintersection_with_screen - Prints the gaze intersection with a screen in pixel coordinates.
  • netclient - Receives UDP packets and prints them to stdout.
